alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 29 at 9:46AM CST until January 29 at 12:45PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 1245 PM CST. * At 946 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Denham Springs, Oak Hills Place, Westminster, Inniswold, Village St. George, Gardere, Shenandoah, Merrydale and Old Jefferson. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 155 and 168. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 5. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
